intro: Cyclostachya, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plants typically have lance-shaped leaves and are native to regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. Cyclostachya species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and prefer full sun. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
